item.title: Rubbish dumped on the street ., 29th November
item.description:
The rubbish from has been dumped on the street . In addition. Hackney council have stopped cleaning the end part of Hertford Road and it hasn’t been cleaned for 5 weeks .

item.title: Parked illegally outside house of visually impaired resident, 29th November

Five lime bikes parked on footway directly outside house of visually impaired resident. The people doing this are quite aware and using Lime bikes as weapons to harass. Fix it, now!

item.title: Another criminal offence flyposted advertisement vinyl banner for Langley Park Boys School has been cabletied to the Council pedestrian guard railings at the junction of South Eden Park Rd and Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Beckenham., 29th November
item.description:
Another criminal offence flyposted advertisement vinyl banner for Langley Park Boys School has been cabletied to the Council pedestrian guard railings at the junction of South Eden Park Rd and Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Beckenham. The blue vinyl banner is about 1.5m x 0.75m. Seen 27th and 28th November 2025.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please reinstate the height warning sign on the metal railway bridge, south side near 90a, Upper Elmers End Rd, Beckenham which was dislodged in a lorry strike about 9 months, ago., 28th November
item.description:
Please reinstate the height warning sign on the metal railway bridge, south side near 90a, Upper Elmers End Rd, Beckenham which was dislodged in a lorry strike about 9 months, ago. The substitute footway, pole-mounted sign is far less prominent and, I would say, inadequate. Bridge strikes cause huge disruption to road and rail traffic, and potential injury / death to drivers and passengers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of 64 - 68 Canfield Gardens, 28th November
item.description:
The road surface is quite damaged with significant dips and potholes which leads to severe vibrations in my property whenever one of the C11 bus pass by. The problem is further aggravated when the bus is electric due to the increased weight of the machine. Considering the issue has been ongoing for months now, can you please urgently action a resurfacing of the road to prevent such holes and subsequent vibrations? thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another day, same problem, 28th November
item.description:
Another day, same problem Rubbish left AGAIN by these flats and not disposed off in the bin Please get in touch with the management of the flats and arrange additional bins. Please review report history to see how many times litter has been reported at this site

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, Greater London

item.title: There is no timetable / route information at all on the double display panel bus stop flag fronting 72, Croydon Rd, Penge SE20 nr jct Melvin Rd., 28th November
item.description:
There is no timetable / route information at all on the double display panel bus stop flag fronting 72, Croydon Rd, Penge SE20 nr jct Melvin Rd. There is room for 6 timetables. Only generic posters are displayed. Please display the timetables for the bus routes serving this stop, for north-east-bound journeys (to Lewisham, Penge, Beckenham, Bromley etc). Routes: 75, 176, 197, 356, 358 and N3.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61-63, Croydon Road, Anerley, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked manhole, 28th November
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council, The issue is now affecting a number of properties. I am writing to seek clarification regarding the ongoing drainage issues on Pickford Close. As previously confirmed by the Council, the drainage system in this area was constructed in the 1930s, and Council teams have attended on multiple occasions in the past to unblock the drainage system via the manhole on 15 Pickford Close. Given this history, I am confused by the recent statement that you are unable to assist. Residents of Pickford Close, including myself, are fully aware that the Council has regularly attended to this issue and carried out the necessary maintenance when blockages occur. Could you please clarify why assistance is now being declined, despite the long-standing responsibility and previous actions taken by the Council? I would appreciate an explanation and confirmation of the next steps, as this issue continues to affect the residents. Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to your prompt response. Thanks & Regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Close, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: House stuff left in an area which should be kept clear. Flytipping Saga continues......, 28th November
item.description:
House stuff including toys, books and furniture left in an area which should be kept clear otherwise it attracts further flytipping and is a fire hazard. Lazy irresponsible residents are responsible. toys and books should have gone to a charity shop. Items moved away for ease of collection when the caged van pulls up yet again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitman Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Pavement uneven and damaged, 28th November
item.description:
Pavement has been damaged for many months. Parts of the slabs are uneven with some pieces coming up. There looks to be a temporary repair but the slabs are not level. It is a hazard for people walking and could be dangerous during icy/ rainy conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lights on the bridge above the highway, 28th November
item.description:
When crossing by the bridge to reach the other side of the “highway” at night, it is pitch black, gloomy and looks dark and unsafe because there is no light on the bridge. When it’s night, I have to use my phone lamp torch to see the path. Also there are debris on this bridge and sometimes people hanging around. Please add some lights! this is not acceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
There are two separate sofas and chairs dumped, one on either side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumbrian Avenue, North End, Greater London

item.title: Ref: 8354962 unsolved issue. Trip hazards., 28th November
item.description:
Only part of the pavement has been fixed from my "solved issue", and the bit that has been fixed is absolutely shocking. No care taken in the look of it at all. Clearly this isn't being signed off by any supervisor as it looks like a blind person has screeded this concrete. As I said in my first complaint, the WHOLE pavement needs re doing in the whole of Dane Close. My mum recently tripped and pulled her muscle in her leg and she's nearly 70. Myself, or others will sue if any further injuries do occure as this has been complained about. As I have said before the road is full of elderly people, one in particular who is scared to use his mobility scooter because of the risk of falling out of it. This needs sorting. James Ball
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Dane Close, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
